alert.note: Alert for Baxter; Marion; Searcy; Stone (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 15 at 2:47PM CDT until May 15 at 5:50PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Baxter County in north central Arkansas... Southeastern Marion County in north central Arkansas... Northern Searcy County in north central Arkansas... Northwestern Stone County in north central Arkansas... * Until 550 PM CDT. * At 247 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Marshall, Maumee, Rush, Thola, Duff, St. Joe, Pindall, Big Flat, Gilbert, Zach, Harriet, Lone Pine, Cozahome, Morning Star, Mull, Maumee Crossing, Landis, Silver Hill and Push Mountian. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
